Key: Oh? If it isn't Itsuka-kun.
Oh, Kusakabe-san.

It's perfect timing. I needed some male
assistance. Do you have time right now?
Erm. I guess. What is it?
It's this. Here.
It's... a car.

Yeah. It's illegally parked. I called the police,
but it's blocking traffic, right? I thought I'd get it
out of the way.

Out of the way... The car? By ourselves?
That might be impossible...

Tsk, tsk, tsk. Don't underestimate the Ground
Self-Defense Force, young man. Here, grab that side.
Er, ah, right.

It'll put some hair on your chest. All right.
One, two!

Good work. You were a great help. Here, have
a coffee.
...Th-Thank you.
That was exhausting...

Ha ha ha. You tried your best. As expected of
a young man. Maybe next time put your back
into it more.
I-I'll work on it...

(Not being totally out breath after moving a
car. The Ground Self-Defense Force is amazing.)
Do you always do stuff like this?

Occasionally. I often witness some sort of
trouble.
Haha. I see. Sounds like you've had a busy day.

Yeah, it's a bother. But it's as easy as helping
an elderly person cross the street.
Is it...?

That's right. You perform acts of kindness often,
don't you Itsuka-kun?
Yes, well... I suppose.

I am part of the Ground Self-Defense Force.
I have to work for the citizens. Even if I'm not
wearing a uniform.
That's nice. Kinda cool.

Itsuka-kun... You're quite honest. We need
talent like yours.
Huh? Er, that's a little...

Hee hee. I'm joking. My underlings tend to
disobey orders and do as they please.
Ahh. That sounds like a handful.
On top of that, my boss is weak and unreliable.

I just wish he would know what it's like
out on the field. You know what I mean,
Itsuka-kun?
Y-Yeah...

(Honestly, I have no idea what she means when
she's talking about work.)

That's why, meeting an honest kid like you who's
also a good listener is refreshing for me.
*sniff*.

(I'm starting to feel bad for her... Origami,
it sounds like your superior's got it rough.)
